alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 2:51PM EST until December 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...PROLONGED WINTER STORM EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY... .Low pressure across the Mid Atlantic will move north and east into southern New England tonight and on Friday...with the season`s first widespread winter storm expected to continue across the area through Saturday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM FRIDAY TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Snowfall amounts of 2 to 6 inches...with the lowest amounts in the Manchester and Nashua area...and the highest amounts across northern Strafford and Rockingham Counties. * WHERE...Strafford, Eastern Hillsborough, and Interior Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM Friday to 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be slick due to snowfall accumulations on roads. Wet snow will cause weighted tree limbs of conifers and leafed trees, leading to snapped branches. Isolated to scattered outages possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as a mix of rain and snow before changing to all snow late Friday and Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
